intro: Selinocarpus, commonly known as the mountain parsley or rock parsley, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plants typically grow in rocky or mountainous areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Selinocarpus species are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. They are also valued as ornamental plants due to their delicate foliage and resilience in challenging environments.
